snippet: Nineteen children died and more fell ill on Tuesday after eating free meals at a primary school in northeastern India.
abstract: Nineteen children die and more fall ill after eating free meals at primary school in northeastern India; preliminary inquiry suggests that food had traces of phosphorus, which is used to preserve rice and wheat.
lead_paragraph: Nineteen children died and more fell ill on Tuesday after eating free meals at a primary school in northeastern India.

headline.main: India: Free School Meals Sicken and Kill Children
headline.print_headline: India: Free School Meals Sicken and Kill Children
